column4: Hi all, can someone help me? i want to remove a package without removing the dependant packages.

nope,, it won't fix certain files which i want it to fix, i've also downlaoded and extracted the deb file and just replaced the postfix-script, postfix-files and post-install files, but they're not quite right, i need to run the install from clean again
so i just need to know how to completely strip out postfix alone and not it's dependant package (courier in this case)
doesn't strip out the package completely, it doesn't replace the postfix-files postfifx-script or post-install files in /etc/postfix either
just be quick on ctrl+c if it starts to do something crazy :)
doesn't seem to delete the files
are you sure the files are coming from postfix and not from postfix-something?
so if that's an indication, i guess they are from postfix package, also dpkg -l | grep postfix reveals only one package
ok, but can't you just copy the conf files from the .deb manualy?
i did copy them from the deb, that didn't work as postfix started producing errors in log from postfix-script of "permission denied" and "file not found"
hm, I'd backup the conf files of the dependencies and then let it purge their files and then reinstall them
yes, do as Flannel says, seems to be less headache
hey man, so i went and purged potfix, allowing it to remove courier-imap and courier-pop along iwth courier-imap-ssl and courier-pop-ssl,,
but now when i restart postfix i get shell-init: error retrieving current directory: getcwd: cannot access parent directories: No such file or directory
